Literature Review: Single-cell multiomics has emerged as a powerful approach to dissecting the complexity of biological systems at an unprecedented resolution. Traditional bulk sequencing methods, while informative, often obscure the heterogeneity within cell populations. Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) has revolutionized our understanding of cellular diversity by providing detailed transcriptomic profiles of individual cells. However, the true potential of single-cell analysis lies in the integration of multiple omics layers, including genomics, epigenomics, proteomics, and spatial information, which together offer a more comprehensive view of cellular function and identity.
